intro: Lonchostoma obtusiflorum, commonly known as the broad-flowered starwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive umbel-like inflorescence composed of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with serrated margins, and it has a taproot system. It is often found in temperate regions of Asia and is noted for its ornamental value in horticulture.
